vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
Included with: ψεῦδος, εος, τό,
Epic dialect dative plural ψεύδεσσι, see at {ψευδής} I.2: (ψεύδω):— falsehood, lie, ψεύδεα.. ἐτύμοισιν ὁμοῖα [Refs 8th c.BC+]; εἴ τε ψεῦδος ὑπόσχεσις εἴ τε καὶ οὐκί whether the promise be a lie or no, [Refs 8th c.BC+]; ψ. ποικίλα, αἰόλον ψ., [Refs]; ψ. γλυκύ a sweet deceit, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 in Logic, false conclusion, fallacy, συλλογισμὸς τοῦ ψεύδους [Refs 4th c.BC+]; συμβαίνει ψ.[Refs] —in “NT” of what is opposed to religious truth, false doctrine, [NT]; ποιῶν βδέλυγμα καὶ ψ., i.e. doing what is repugnant to the true faith, [NT]; of false anatomical doctrine, τὸ οἴεσθαι.. ψ. ἐστι [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II in [Refs 3rd c.BC+] are spots, pimples on the nose; supposed to be characteristic of liars, cf. Scholia (at [prev. work]); compare ψυδράκιον.
__II.2 white spots on the fingernails, [Refs 3rd c.AD+]
__III In [Refs 5th c.BC+]; so almost like an adjective (compare ψευδής [near the start]), ὄνομα ψεῦδος καὶ ἀληθὲς λέγειν [Refs 5th c.BC+]
